content.title: Axillary Artery Anatomy
content.description: Continuation of subclavian artery from lateral border of first rib to lower border of teres major, divided into three parts by pectoralis minor muscle.

boundaries.proximal: Lateral border of first rib (from subclavian)
boundaries.distal: Lower border of teres major (becomes brachial)

branches.third_part: Subscapular, anterior and posterior circumflex humeral (3 branches)

relations.brachial_plexus: Cords surround second part (lateral, posterior, medial)

content.clinical_relevance: Important for dialysis access, extra-anatomic bypass, trauma
content.statement: Axillary Artery Anatomy is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Anatomy Upper-Extremity that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Axillary Artery Anatomy helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Axillary Artery Anatomy include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Axillary Artery Anatomy.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Axillary Artery Anatomy. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
